skillTree.localised_description: The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.
The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Goldilock is the personal companion of the Arch-Priest of Haeyndrik, it's rider is said to be forever lucky in his endeavors.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: ''You can mock me with fakery, Peasant? I can smell carat in Gold bars and Jewelry from miles!''
Simon requires no aid to judge the worth of a commodity, it comes as natural as breathing to him.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: People pray to Haeyndrik to bless their transactions, binding all parties to their agreements, even if that agreements forces them to lower arms.
''No no no.. You're doing it all wrong. It's all about the right diversion between wealth and property tax. Here, let me help''.
Goudenkruin always strolls with the most exotic and fine wares available. Lords and heroes looking to keep up with the latest Cathayan trends tend to take note when Simon uses his contacts.

effects.description:
Golden Idols resource production: 10 chests
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Simon pleads with his God to make sure that there will be a local merchant willing to deal with him. The prospect of profit envigorates his devotees.
Every city that houses a temple of Haeyndrik prospers. Or every Temple of Haeyndriks prospers.. One or the other.

The most susceptible for Haeyndrik's appeal are those ambitious of power, money and influence. They would offer their gold to the power of wealth for the chance alone of seeing it doubled. One of his loyal devotees is Pieter de Groot, who aspires to become the richest known to man one day.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -35 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Prayers cause Goudenkruin's competitors and allies to speak well of him. All characters within range talk well of their past dealings with him, no matter how bad they may have been. It allows him to speak with the tongue of Haenydrik himself, drowning enemies in gold and coin with the mere words he speaks.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Goudenkruin would often mutter prayers to the Merchant God and every transaction seems to go your way. This luck translates to the battlefield, where blows simply brush off the Arch-Priest
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text: Brother Gerardus Hondschoen has always enjoyed a challenge - ever since he was a lad in Suiddock, stealing to support his mother, he's relished going into places he shouldn't, taking things that weren't his and doing his best to embarrass the rich and powerful. A locked safe is like tossing down the glove to him, a duel between him and the locksmith. A greedy landlord is someone just begging to have a chamber pot emptied on his head. Gerardus believes Simon Goudenkruin is the key to wealth, using his patrons as willing victims.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +35%

items.colour_text: There are but few artifacts of real importance to the Cult of Haeyndrik, and the ceremonial mace counts among the rarest of them all. It is said to be imbued with a form of magical luck, enabling it's wielder a positive outcome in any given situation. It is not hard to imagine how Simon Goudenkruin earned himself the title ''Haeyndrik's Profit'', where his track record in business deals is beyond successful. Whether the mace plays a part in that, or Simon truly is talented and gifted, remains unanswered. No matter the reason, the mace is as potent as it is grandeur.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Money, power, and influence—these are my Gods. And Haeyndrik represents all that is money, power, and influence."

effects.description:
Income from trade-good producing buildings: +50%
	(local province)
